feels.name: Trust
feels.quote: Caleb had no cant at command, even if he could have chosen to use it; and he had been accustomed to meet all such difficulties in no other way than by doing his 'business' faithfully.

feels.name: Joy
feels.quote: The young ones have always a claim on the old to help them forward. I was young myself once and had to do without much help; but help would have been welcome to me, if it had been only for the fellow-feeling's sake.

feels.name: Acceptance
feels.quote: The children are fond of each other—I mean, Fred and Mary.

causedByEvent.name: Fred and Mary's feelings for each other

feels.name: Surprise
feels.quote: The accidents of the morning had helped his frustrated imagination to shape an employment for himself which had several attractions.

feels.name: Joy
feels.quote: His spirits had risen, and he heartily enjoyed a good slip in the moist earth under the hedgerow, which soiled his perfect summer trousers.

causedByEvent.name: Enjoying the slip in the earth

feels.name: Anticipation
feels.quote: He can't bear to be a clergyman, and Mary says she won't have him if he is one; and the lad would like to be under me and give his mind to business. And I've determined to take him and make a man of him.

feels.name: Acceptance
feels.quote: The children are fond of each other—I mean, Fred and Mary.

causedByEvent.name: Fred and Mary's feelings for each other

feels.name: Joy
feels.quote: The young ones have always a claim on the old to help them forward. I was young myself once and had to do without much help; but help would have been welcome to me, if it had been only for the fellow-feeling's sake.
